resources.string: Ads are disabled. Ads support the development of this App
Give feedback, suggest or ask something
Rate this App in the Play Store
Licences of libraries used in this App

To add a Vocable go to the Vocablelist and click on the \'+\' button. A dialog will open and you can type in your vocable. If you click on the \'+\' icons on the right of the textboxes another textbox will appear in which you can insert more meanings for your vocable. You can provide a Hint that you can view in the test. In the last step you must select a unit or create a new one. The small arrow on the right allows you to toggle between creating a new one and selecting an existing one.

To delete Vocables you go to the Vocablelist and swipe them away. This is evan possible with whole units. If you made a mistake you can undo the deletion by clicking the undo button at the bottom of the screen. If you want to delete all of your Vocables click the bin icon.

You can import already prepared lists into Vocabletrainer. To do so go to the vocablelist and select 'import' from the menu. A filebrowser will open in which you can select your file to import. The file-type must be either xml or csv. If you want to create a list fast at your computer create a text file and save it as csv. Example:
Hello,Greetings;Hallo;English-German
Goodbye;Tschüss,Auf Wiedersehen;English-German
The xml file-type is for the backups of Vocabletrainer; see 'Export'

You can make a backup of your vocablelist to share it to other devices or just to save your list. If you want to create a backup go to the vocablelist and select \'export\' from the menu. A filexplorer opens and you can select in which directory the backup file should be saved. if you found a directory click on the save button. The file-type of the backup is xml and you can open it with any text editor.
